question.body: As the confidence level increased from 80% to 99%, what happened to the centers of the intervals—the dots representing each sample mean (x-bar)? If you’re not sure, you can change the confidence level again and observe the intervals.

explanation.p: As the confidence level changed, the centers of the intervals remained the same (because the x-bars remain the same). This shouldn’t be surprising, because the confidence level is only used after the sample has been selected.
